Private albums are albums that only the creator can view
Restricted access albums are albums that only the creator and designated users can view
Maximum number of images per album

These settings rely on the detailed bandwidth log which can be disabled in the Gallery Settings and cleared periodically. If using these settings, it is recommended that you leave the log turned on and set not to clear more often than every 48 hours otherwise you may experience unexpected behavior.
Users will still be able to download the large size image through their browser

You can control which groups are allowed to create albums from Group Settings. If you require albums but the user does not have permission to create albums, they will not be able to submit to this category.
Images can only be submitted directly to the category
Images can be submitted directly to the category or to albums within the category
Images can only be submitted to albums within the category
If using a closed system, users will have to choose from these tags. If using an open system, tags entered here will show as suggestions.
The rules will be shown on a separate page with a link added in the category header
The rules will be shown inline in the category header

If you choose not to delete images in this category, you must select a new category or album to move them to instead

Will be able to move images only between the categories they can create new content within.

Can recommend comments on an image?
Can remove comment recommendations on an image?

Copies of all images uploaded to the gallery are created at different sizes and are then used as appropriate in the interface throughout the gallery. You can control the maximum dimensions of each size below.

The image provided will be overlaid on all gallery images (for example, to show a copyright message). Be aware that individual categories can disable the watermark on images. For best results, use a small image with a transparent background.

Enabling this setting will cause Gallery image views to tracked. You can then use the bandwidth logs to see how much bandwidth image views consume over periods of time, and you can view bandwidth statistics on a per-member basis when editing members.
Detailed bandwidth logs older than this timeframe will be pruned to improve performance. Certain statistics requiring these logs will no longer be available once the bandwidth logs are pruned.

Users can choose whether or not to show a map next to images that have geolocation data embedded into the image. This option controls whether those maps are enabled by default or not, however users can override this preference while submitting their images.
disabled ability to upload Gallery images
restored ability to upload Gallery images
* This statistic comes from the bandwidth log which may be disabled or set to be pruned periodically.
This data comes from the bandwidth log which may be disabled or set to be pruned periodically.
